intro: Delostylis cernuum, commonly known as the hanging lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its drooping inflorescences. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Delostylis cernuum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
